features: WELL PROVEN QUALITY: The design of our thermal paste packagings has changed several times, the formula of the composition has remained unchanged, so our MX pastes have stood for high quality

EXCELLENT PERFORMANCE: ARCTIC MX-4 thermal paste is made of carbon microparticles, guaranteeing extremely high thermal conductivity. This ensures that heat from the CPU/GPU is dissipated quickly & efficiently
SAFE APPLICATION: The MX-4 is metal-free and non-electrical conductive which eliminates any risks of causing short circuit, adding more protection to the CPU and VGA cards
100 % ORIGINAL THROUGH AUTHENTICITY CHECK: Through our Authenticity Check, it is possible to verify the authenticity of every single product
EASY TO APPLY: With an ideal consistency, the MX-4 is very easy to use, even for beginners, Spatula incl.

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: High thermal conductivity The surfaces of processor chips and cooler floors are covered with microscopic dents; ARCTIC‘s MX-4 thermal paste is composed of carbon microparticles which fill these cavities. This leads to extremely high thermal conductivity, ensuring that heat is dissipated quickly and efficiently from the CPU or GPU. With its outstanding performance, the MX-4 is not only an excellent choice for overclockers and enthusiasts, but also for other sapplications that require thermal transmission. Easy application Thanks to its consistency, MX-4 is easy to apply, even for beginners. The video in the picture gallery demonstrates the application technique to avoid air pockets between processors and coolers. Secure usage In contrast to pastes based on metal oxides or liquid metal, ARCTIC’s MX-4 is metal-free and not electrically conductive. This eliminates the risk of short circuiting, and eliminates the need to worry about corrosion damage to the radiator floor caused by liquid metal. 100 % original through Authenticity Check To ensure that your paste is genuine, there is the ARCTIC Authenticity Check. This allows every product to be reliably verified. A counterfeit offers neither the performance nor the durability of the original ARCTIC pastes.
Technical Specifications Density: 2.50 g/cm³ Viscosity: 31,600 Poise Volume Resistivity: 3.8 x 10¹³ Ω-cm Continuous Use Temperature: -50~150 °C Colour: Grey

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 5, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars A most under-appreciated item.
reviews.reviewText: I am about a week on the other side of a recent system build. Meaning that the new system has been in service for about a week. Why did I label this an under-appreciated item? Because without it the CPU probably wouldn't have lasted a minute. Ok, the truth is that if one is building on a motherboard built this century, then the board itself is probably smart enough to shut things down before the CPU cooks. But if one has built a system in the past year, then one knows just how difficult it is to get the core components at present. So, yeah, cooking the CPU would have a more profound and less recoverable connotation.Enter, thermal paste. More specifically, enter one of the most recent formulations of thermal paste. I chose this one because it has significantly higher thermal transmission gradient than the best formulations available just a few years ago, and came in at half the price of its next competitor (at the time of purchase). In reality, they are all priced about the same, but many come with half the volume of stuff inside the tube. And suppose one makes a mistake the first time had needs a do-over (that didn't happen to me, but I prepared for it none the less). So, at about $9 for 4 ml; if this were gasoline it would cost over $170K to fill a 20 gal tank! The other guys were selling 2 ml for the same price so thankfully my car doesn't run on this stuff.But not using it can spend about $200 to $20,000 (Intel Xeon and AMD Epyc CPU builds can start touching this magnitude of cash) in less than a minute. So far, I have stressed my system during video rendering and compositing on a few occasions - it's ok, that's what it was built to do. The CPU is factory rated at 90 degrees C - that's almost hot enough to boil water, but that is the factory established LIMIT. Using this paste along with a liquid-cooled thermal management scheme, my CPU has never gone above 61C during any operation to date including the most stressful. The thermal paste is the transmitter between the CPU and the heatsink. So no cooling strategy will be any more efficient than the paste will allow.Another reason for purchasing a tube with extra paste; some builds use more than one CPU, and sometimes there's an options to provide additional cooling to the GPU. M.2 memory tends to run pretty warm and use heatsinks as well. The point being, anytime there's a heatsink, using thermal paste at the junction will enhance the heatsink's ability to cool the component - the better the paste, the more efficient the cooling. And cooler components run faster and smoother. Solid State memory slows down significantly at higher temperatures, it's called throttling for anyone looking at their first build. So I probably used less than 1 ml to install the CPU - it's more art than exact science, but having more left over is helpful if one has numerous heatsinks to treat during the build.This paste emerged from the tube in a predictable manner - which is good considering the cost per ounce. It came with a mini-spatula for spreading. It sort of resembles a pizza peel if one were providing their pet hamster with its own pizza oven, but I digress. Spreading the paste prior to installing the CPU cooler was very easy and controllable. I was able to achieve edge to edge over the CPU without any dripping to the motherboard - nice, neat, mess-free application. There's also a rating for noise level....ok....um...this paste is pretty quiet. (Amazon asks reviewers to rate a few areas that are not necessarily presented in the public review space other than as an aggregate score).My CPU was at 24C (room temperature) when I powered up this afternoon. It is now at 37C and hasn't gone above 43C during this session. That was probably during Windows boot up. It runs typically between 34C and 38C during low demand. I have read some reviews in which folks describe their systems as running nominally ay 70C! (Methinks these are gaming rigs under full load). So, I guess based on all of this, this paste is pretty effective. But it can only be as effective as the rest of the cooling system it supports. At least I can confidently say that it is not likely to be a weak link - and it has a rating for efficacy over 8 years! I would purchase it again - but I wouldn't fill the gas tank with it.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 21, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Easy to apply and works great
reviews.reviewText: I noticed my CPU was getting pretty hot when idle so I decided to buy this thermal paste and after applying it my CPU runs cooler than when I first got it! I had the preapplied stuff they put on heat sinks on it previously but this stuff seems to work a lot better.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 6, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars very solid choice for thermal paste
reviews.reviewText: this is a great choice for any thermal paste application, the spatula was helpful and the paste itself was easy to spread to the edges of my 5600x. temps have been great, and I still have a ton of paste left in the tube if I need to reapply. I recommend!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 31, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Cheap and easy to use
reviews.reviewText: Cheap and easy to use. I just needed a single syringe to install a new cooler. Worked as described.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 14, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Reliable, but not the best.
reviews.reviewText: Been using Arctic Silver for years, this is similar but honestly is pretty par for the course. I've actually seen temp differences when using another brand like Noctua, but this does the trick if you just want to put any kind of thermal paste on and call it a day.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 17, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Shipped fast, easy to use
reviews.reviewText: The added spatula is especially appreciated. Simple fix to an age old challenge when using thermal paste. The amount of paste in the tube was just right IMO. Enough to do the job with a bit extra, but not so much extra that I feel guilty pitching the left over.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 31, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Lowered my temps!
reviews.reviewText: I did not think too much when I decided to apply the stock thermal paste that came with my CPU fan and used that for a while. I did notice that temps were a bit high but I did not want to bother with trying to reseat the fan. It's been a couple years and I decided I wanted to reseat my fan with better thermal paste and the results really showed. I saw my temps decrease by a lot. I am never using stock thermal paste again. This is definitely worth the very low price!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 18, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Worked great - easy to use and is standard!
reviews.reviewText: I consider this to be the "standard" thermal paste for building your own computer. I used this to repaste some old mini pc's that had dried out. The tube is actually pretty generous, and for smaller CPUs, this will go a LONG way. The included spatula is also pretty handy.No need to shell out for super high end thermal paste when all you'll get is a few degrees (at most) difference in thermals!

reviews.reviewTitle: One of the best decisions I’ve made !!
reviews.reviewText: Bought this thermal paste a few days ago because my laptop was running very hot (85c - 95C). Which was making my games crash at such high temperatures. So I figured that it might need a repaste after 3 years of using. Opened up the laptop and found out that factory thermal paste was not spread properly. Half of the cpu was not covered by factory thermal paste and some other chips on the side had some uneven spread. Alot of the paste was on the board itself rather then being on the cpu and other chips. So i did a complete repaste and covered everything properly. It made a huge frickin difference in cooling temperatures. Even at heavy usage the temperature never went above 70C. And the games actually stopped crashing. Hell of a difference it made there. I’m glad I purchased this paste. I had read about this paste already. So just went for it straight. Really happy and satisfied with it. Does an Awesome job. Now my laptop Probably be good for another 3-4 years.

Entrega muito rápida, fiz o pedido dia 10/06 e ela chegou dia 18/06 no Maranhão. É uma ótima pasta, ela vale o valor que ela propõe, tenho um R5 3600 e moro no Nordeste e aqui é bem quente, com ela o processador fica entre 60° a 65°, e usei também na minha GTX 1650, uma GPU que já é fria, e com essa pasta fica uma maravilha, dificilmente ela passa dos 60°, e acredito que ainda posso usar ela em umas 5 a 6 aplicações ainda.
Very good product CPU temperature around 38⁰ to 60⁰ something i5 11gen processor using Intel own hitsing

Piccola recensione della pasta termica che ho avuto il piacere di provare di recente: l'Arctic MX-4.Questa pasta termica è una delle più popolari e apprezzate sul mercato, e non è difficile capire il perché.Innanzitutto, la MX-4 ha un'ottima conducibilità termica. Questo significa che garantisce una buona trasmissione del calore tra il processore o la scheda video e il dissipatore, contribuendo a mantenere le temperature sotto controllo.In secondo luogo, la MX-4 è facile da applicare. Basta seguire la semplice tecnica del "chicco di riso" per ottenere una distribuzione uniforme e omogenea. Sul sito ufficiale ci sono anche video tutorial.Infine, la MX-4 è dichiarata durevole. Ovviamente questo al momento non lo posso verificare, ma dalle recensioni online sembra essere così.Io ho utilizzato la MX-4 sul mio computer prima con un Ryzen 7 2700x e dissipatore stock AMD e successivamente su un i5 13600k e dissipatore Noctua.Nel primo caso rispetto alla pasta termica di serie notato una piccola riduzione delle temperatura.Questo significa che il processore può funzionare a una frequenza maggiore per periodi di tempo più lunghi, senza rischiare di surriscaldarsi.In conclusione, la Arctic MX-4 è una pasta termica ottima per chi vuole ottenere le migliori prestazioni dal proprio computer. È facile da applicare, ha una buona conducibilità termica.Se state cercando una nuova pasta termica, vi consiglio di prenderla in considerazione.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on January 3, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Easy to apply and made a huge difference on PS4 Pro! Fan is so silent now, and no more jet engine sound!
